section.title: Import Collection
section.para: This action and its sub-menu items relate to the creation of a new record and is dedicated to the Import Collection (IC) product. The goal of this function is to let the Presenting/Collecting Bank notify its customer of the collection instructions for which they are the designated drawee. Import Collection
The principle of this feature is similar to the Export Notification and Received Standby LC functions earlier in this guide.

section.para:

section.title: From Scratch - Documents
section.para: In this area, the drawer can select the documents attached to its collection. When the Add Documents button is clicked, a sub-form is show with the following fields.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

The drawer must select here the type of the current document. The following values can be selected from the drop-down list: Bill of Exchange / Draft, Signed Commercial Invoice, Insurance Policy / Certificate, Packing List, Certificate of Origin, Inspection Certificate, Signed Bill of Lading, Non Negotiable Bill of Lading, Air Way Bill or Other.
When selecting Other, the drawer must specify the related document description in the free format input field (maximum of 255 characters).

For each document, the number of originals delivered can be indicated. Note that the field is not restricted to numeric items, and can contain strings of up to 20 characters such as for instance 1/2 to indicate one among two in this mail.

section.title: Import Collection - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para:
This option is used by an authorised bank user, to submit an Import Collection notification that a bank user has already started but been unable to submit due to insufficient authority. Retrieve
Unsigned Import Collection
Import Collection
Retrieve Unsigned
Retrieve Unsigned
Import Collection

When this option is selected, a list is displayed of Import Collection notifications that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the
column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. If sufficient authorisations are allocated in the profile of the authorising user, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which must be ticked to select it. A Submit button at the end of the page, submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is re-displayed.
